notes: Red Hat is the world's largest open-source software company, acquired by IBM in 2019. Key products: RHEL (Red Hat Enterprise Linux, the enterprise standard), OpenShift (Kubernetes platform), Ansible (automation), Fedora (upstream community distribution). RHEL and its derivatives (CentOS Stream, Rocky, Alma, Oracle Linux) run most enterprise Linux workloads. Red Hat Product Security handles vulnerability response.

data.description: Red Hat's advisory system publishing security fixes (RHSA), bug fixes (RHBA), and enhancements (RHEA) for Red Hat products.
data.notes: Errata IDs contain colons (e.g., RHSA-2024:1234) — preserve the colon in subpaths. RHSA advisories often bundle fixes for multiple CVEs in a single errata. Errata are tied to specific product versions and architectures. Each errata includes affected packages and their updated versions. Security advisories (RHSA) include severity ratings. The number after the colon is sequential within a year.

children.description: Red Hat Security Advisory — security vulnerability fixes
Red Hat Bug Advisory — non-security bug fixes
Red Hat Enhancement Advisory — new features

data.description: Red Hat's own CVE analysis pages with Red Hat-specific CVSS scores, affected products, and mitigation guidance.
data.notes: Red Hat CVE pages have their own CVSS scores which may differ from NVD. Includes RHEL-specific mitigation and remediation guidance. Shows which Red Hat products are affected. Links to related errata (RHSA) that fix the CVE. CVE pages describe the vulnerability; errata (RHSA/RHBA/RHEA) are the actual fixes.

data.description: Red Hat's bug tracking system where security bugs are tracked with CVE aliases.
data.notes: Bugzilla supports CVE aliases — you can look up a bug by its CVE identifier and Bugzilla redirects to the actual bug. Both numeric bug IDs and CVE aliases are valid SecID subpaths. Prefer the numeric bug ID for stability (aliases can theoretically change, though this is rare). Security bugs often have restricted access until fixes are released. One bug may track multiple CVEs (or vice versa in rare cases).

children.description: CVE alias — Bugzilla redirects to the associated bug
